III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/19/25, a youth was assaulted by another youth at the facility.
One youth sustained a bruise to their hip. Staff intervened and
stopped the altercation. Law enforcement responded to another
incident at the home following this incident in which a youth was
assaulting a staff member. During that time, a youth from the first
incident wanted to make a police report and claims a staff member
denied them the ability to do so. On 3/20/25, the youth was
brought to the police station to file a report.
Investigation Interviews
Messages were left for Complainant on 04/04/2025 and
04/16/2025. A return call was not received.
Youth A was interviewed on 03/24/2025 at Beverly House. Youth
A stated Staff 2 wanted her to sleep in her own bed in the
bedroom on 03/19/2025. Youth A stated she went back and forth
with Staff 2 because the couch is more comfortable than her bed.
Youth A stated Youth B yelled and said, “Shut the fuck up.” Youth
A stated she ignored Youth B but Youth B said, “Shut the fuck up”
again. Youth A stated she asked Youth B to mind her own
business, and this prompted Youth B to throw a plate, bowl and
two cups of water at Youth A. Youth A stated she then walked
towards Youth B by the kitchen sink and swung at Youth B. Youth
A stated Youth B swung back and pushed Youth A down into the
kitchen counter. Youth A stated Staff 1 and Staff 2 intervened and
stood between Youth A and Youth B to keep them separated.
Youth A stated she accidentally punched Staff 1’s arm and pulled
Staff 2’s hair because she was trying to get to Youth B. Youth A
stated Staff 1 and Staff 2 redirected Youth A to walk away and
Youth A walked into the living room. Youth A stated Staff 2
redirected Youth B to her bedroom and the incident ended. Youth
A stated she requested to file a police report because Youth B
2

threw a plate, bowl and water at her. Youth A stated staff took her
on 03/20/2025 to the police station to file the police report. Youth
A stated the bruise on her rib cage from hitting the kitchen counter
in this incident healed.
Youth B was interviewed on 03/24/2025 at Beverly House. Youth
B stated she and Youth A argued in the kitchen and started to
swing on each other. Youth B stated she does not recall what they
argued about, but Youth A yelled profanity at Youth B. Youth B
stated Staff 2 redirected Youth A without success and Youth B
told Youth A to “shut up” multiple times without success. Youth B
stated Youth A “got in her face” and Youth B threw water at Youth
A. Youth B stated Youth A grabbed Youth B’s shirt and hit her and
Youth B hit back even with Staff 1 or Staff 2 standing between
them. Youth B stated she followed either Staff 1 or Staff 2’s
redirection to go to her bedroom and the incident ended. Youth B
stated she was not injured in this incident.
Youth C was interviewed on 03/24/2025 at Beverly House. Youth
C stated Youth A was upset about something and told Youth B to
“beat her ass”. Youth C stated Youth A and Youth B started to
swing at each other in the kitchen. Youth C stated Staff 1 and
Staff 2 intervened by stepping between Youth A and Youth B and
the incident ended. Youth C stated Youth B left the kitchen, went
to her bedroom and then took a shower.
Youth D was interviewed on 04/03/2025 at Beverly House. Youth
D stated she does not recall what started Youth A and Youth B’s
physical altercation but staff (does not recall who) intervened
(does not recall how). Youth D stated the incident ended when the
youths went to their bedrooms. Youth D stated she did not have
additional details to share.
Youth E declined to be interviewed on 03/24/2025 and
04/03/2025 at Beverly House.
Youth F was interviewed on 04/03/2025 at Beverly House. Youth
F stated she was not present during Youth A and Youth B’s
physical altercation because she was on a home pass on
03/19/2025.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 03/24/2025 at Beverly House. Staff 1
stated Youth A was upset and talking loudly with Staff 2 in front of
the staff office area while Youth B completed chores in the
kitchen. Staff 1 stated Youth B told Youth A to “shut the fuck up”,
which caused Youth A to get louder. Staff 1 stated she redirected
3

Youth B’s language and Youth B returned to her chores. Staff 1
stated she went to the living room and returned when Youth B
threw bowls of water at Youth A. Staff 1 stated she slipped on the
water as Youth A and Youth B swung at each other. Staff 1 stated
she and Staff 2 stepped between Youth A and Youth B and
redirected Youth A and Youth B to their bedrooms. Staff 1 stated
the youths went to their bedrooms and the incident ended.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 04/01/2025 by phone because she is
on personal leave. Staff 2 stated Youth A was upset and yelling
because Youth B refused to get out of the car earlier, which
caused Youth A and Youth B to miss their doctor’s appointment.
Staff 2 stated Youth B told Youth A to “shut up” and they started to
yell at each other. Staff 2 stated Youth A and Youth B did not
comply with verbal de-escalation. Staff 2 stated Youth B threw
water at Youth A and they started to swing at each other. Staff 2
stated she and Staff 1 stepped between Youth A and Youth B.
Staff 2 stated she held her arms out to the side to keep Youth A
and Youth B separate and directed them to go their bedrooms.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 04/01/2025 by phone because she
resigned from Beverly House on 03/19/2025. Staff 3 stated Youth
A was upset and yelling at Staff 1 about not wanting to sleep in
her bed. Staff 3 stated she redirected Youth A to lower her voice
but Youth A continued to yell and said she was not lowering her
voice. Staff 3 stated Youth B became agitated and yelled at Youth
A to “shut the fuck up” and took a cup of water and threw it at
Youth A and Staff 3. Staff 3 stated Youth A started yelling about
being assaulted and went towards Youth B. Staff 3 stated Youth B
pushed Youth A back into the kitchen counter. Staff 3 stated Staff
1 and Staff 2 separated Youth A and Youth B by standing
between them. Staff 3 stated Staff 2 redirected Youth A and Youth
B to go to their bedrooms but Youth A refused and went to the
living room without further incident.
Video
03/19/2025 Beverly House video shows Youth B standing at the
kitchen sink and Youth A talking with Staff 2 and Youth C standing
behind Staff 2. At 8:33:43 PM Youth B tosses a bowl of water at
Youth A. Youth A walks around the peninsula kitchen counter
towards Youth B and Youth B tosses another bowl of water at
Youth A. Staff 1 walks into the kitchen from the living room and
Staff 2 follows behind Youth A. Youth A raises her left hand and
hits Youth B at 8:33:48 PM. Staff 1 and Staff 2 move with their
arms stretched out to stand between Youth A and Youth B as
Youth B pushes Youth A down into the peninsula kitchen counter.
4

Youth A gets up and Youth A and Youth B try to swing at each
other but Staff 1 and Staff 2 stand between them with their arms
stretched out. The incident ends at 8:34:00 PM.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 2 wrote the incident report for Youth A and Youth B’s
physical altercation on 03/19/2025 at 8:00 PM in the
kitchen. The incident report coincides with Staff 2’s
interview.
• Beverly House’s program statement states the facility has a
capacity for six youths. Minimum waking hour staffing is
one staff for three youths. Due to the current six youths in
care, staffing is increased to three or four staff on afternoon
shift when possible, per Chief Administrator. This increase
in staffing was verified through the review of 03/24/2025 to
04/05/2025 staffing schedule.
• Beverly House placed Youth A and Youth B on a daily
separation plan that involves staggered wake up, meals,
chores and hygiene times effective 04/01/2025 due to their
conflictual relationship.
Tour
Upon entering Beverly House from the front door, one steps into
the living room. To the right of the living room is a full bathroom
and two double occupancy bedrooms. To the left of the living
room is a double occupancy bedroom with a full attached
bathroom. As one walks through the living room, it leads to the
dining room with a large rectangular table and chairs. To the right
of the dining room is a full kitchen. A den with couches, two
computer stations and a television is located directly past the
dining room. Stepping to the left of the dining room is a laundry
room. A sunken foyer area with the agency’s side entrance and a
staff office adjoins the laundry room.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance in providing for the needs,
protection and supervision of Youth A and Youth B when Staff 1,
Staff 2 and Staff 3 intervened in their 03/19/2025 physical
altercation, increased staffing pattern and separation plan.
CONSULTATION
Consultation was provided to move a desk from the den or place
another desk in the living room corner furthest away from the
dining room for a potentially quieter, separate space for a youth.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
